title: Online HCI Course Design: EXD Model-Based Education for Practitioner Competency Enhancement

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital tool proficiency and understanding of HCI (Human-Computer Interaction) concepts
context.additional_context: A blended education course for current practitioners to strengthen HCI (Human-Computer Interaction) theory and practical application competencies, conducted in a smartphone-centric limited-technology environment. Continuous feedback and improvement occur through formative assessments

learning_goals: Learners can apply HCI fundamental principles (user-centered design, interaction patterns) to practical case studies
Learners can propose strategies for applying core elements of the e-learning experience design (EXD) model (agile methodology, design thinking) to online education
Learners can analyze the usability of digital content using HCI evaluation tools accessible in smartphone environments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
